info.game_comments:
2003 College Championship semifinal game 3.
From Yale University.

(1, 1).clue: Speaking at an 1848 convention, Elizabeth Cady Stanton said, "We now demand our right to" do this

(2, 1).clue: In a 2001 film, Will Smith played this heavyweight boxer known as "The Greatest"

(3, 1).clue: A state capital is not named after him

(4, 1).clue: In Italy these are distinguished as peperoni rossi & peperoni verdi

(5, 1).clue: "Betcha can't eat just one" of this brand of potato chips

(1, 2).clue: He was a Vice Presidential candidate when he made his famous "Checkers" speech in 1952

(2, 2).clue: Nickname shared by middleweight champ Graziano, heavyweight champ Marciano & a certain movie title hero

(3, 2).clue: Did not serve 2 full terms as President

(4, 2).clue: In Espanol it's espinaca (& I'm still not eating it)

(5, 2).clue: This leading newspaper exhibits "all the news that's fit to print"

(6, 2).clue: The prodigal son's father serves it up for him in the Book of Luke

(1, 3).clue: Once a prisoner, his 1994 inaugural address included the words "Let freedom reign ... God bless Africa ... thank you"

(2, 3).clue: Seen here, he's been a heavyweight boxing champ since 2001

(4, 3).clue: In French they're petits pois & weird people use a knife & honey to eat them

(5, 3).clue: Use this shipping company "when it absolutely, positively has to be there overnight"

(6, 3).clue: He's the early Rock & Roll legend heard here: I found my thrill on Blueberry Hill

(1, 4).clue: She's the speaker heard here in the 1930s: "And in all the marvels of modern invention, that with which I am most concerned is, of course, air transportation. Flying is perhaps the most dramatic of recent scientific attainments."

(2, 4).clue: Early in his career Joe Louis boxed his way to become a champ in these amateur competitions that began in 1926

(4, 4).clue: In Polish it's cebula; you can cry out your response now

(5, 4).clue: According to De Beers, one of these "is forever"

(6, 4).clue: Salman Rushdie had one issued against him in 1989

(1, 5).clue: Convicted in Athens in 399 B.C. he said, "It is now time to depart -- for me to die, for you to live"

(2, 5).clue: Last name of brothers Leon & Michael, who were the first 2 brothers to hold world heavyweight boxing titles

(4, 5).clue: In a Caribbean mood in Sweden? You might serve your svarta bonor, these, with kokat ris, "white rice"

(5, 5).clue: This company asks, "Where do you want to go today?"

(6, 5).clue: It's believed the Virgin Mary appeared near this Portuguese village in 1917

(1, 1).clue: This oxygen-carrying substance gives red blood cells their color

(2, 1).clue: This character is the father of Scott, Seth's character in the Austin Powers film

(3, 1).clue: 26-year-old Michelangelo used a nearly 40-year-old marble block for his sculpture of this Biblical man

(4, 1).clue: Several species of giant tortoise & over 7 dozen species of birds inhabit this Ecuadoran island group

(5, 1).clue: Coincidentally, New Haven still had streetcars of its own when this southern drama premiered here in 1947

(6, 1).clue: Of belletristic, bellwether or bellicose, the one that means "provocatively warlike"

(1, 2).clue: It's what the "M" stands for in mRNA, a single-stranded type of RNA

(2, 2).clue: Back in 1988 Seth was in "My Stepmother is an Alien" with this actress who 10 years later he dated on "Buffy"

(3, 2).clue: Salvador Dali lectured in a diving suit at a famous exhibition of this movement in 1936

(4, 2).clue: On July 23, 2001 Megawati Sukarnoputri became this archipelago's first woman President

(5, 2).clue: This ever-popular musical set in 1938 Austria debuted in New Haven in 1959

(6, 2).clue: Lachrymal means marked by these, & please refrain from shedding them when you respond

(1, 3).clue: Protozoans, slime molds & eukaryotic algae are members of this kingdom

(2, 3).clue: Seth worked with Breckin Meyer in "Rat Race", "Can't Hardly Wait" & as part of Du Jour, a boy band in this 2001 film

(3, 3).clue: This masterpiece of Hellenistic sculpture is seen here and at the Louvre

(4, 3).clue: Columbus' first landing in the New World was probably in this archipelago, now an independent nation

(5, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from the Yale Repertory Theatre in New Haven) Appropriately, this "Catch-22" author's play, "We Bombed in New Haven," opened in New Haven, at Yale Rep.

(6, 3).clue: When you say Brobdingnagian, say it "Swift"ly, because the word was inspired by this novel

(1, 4).clue: Butterflies take in oxygen through these, breathing holes located on the sides of the abdomen

(2, 4).clue: Seth's character in this 2003 heist film claimed he invented Napster & his roommate stole it while he "nap"ped

(3, 4).clue: Born in 1898 & trained as an engineer, he turned to art in his 20s & began making stabiles & mobiles

(4, 4).clue: Cape Kumukahi is the easternmost point in this Pacific archipelago

(5, 4).clue: This musical featuring Curly, Jud & Laurey was called "Away We Go!" when it tried out in New Haven in 1943

(6, 4).clue: Instead of saying "popular opinion", try substituting this Latin phrase, literally "voice of the people"

(1, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew presents in front of a blackboard) A 2-carbon compound and protein are converted to CO2 and water in this cycle that turns food into energy

(2, 5).clue: In this 1999 comedy horror film, Seth is killed by his pal's possessed right mitt

(3, 5).clue: Dots of color are applied on the canvas so that they fuse at a distance in the viewer's eye in this technique

(4, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Alaska) From Sitka on Baranoff Island, you can see other islands in the archipelago named for this Czar who sold Alaska

(5, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew presents from the Yale Repertory Theatre in New Haven, CT) His play "Fences" was originally staged here at Yale Rep. It moved to Broadway and won him his first Pulitzer Prize

(6, 5).clue: To tutoyer is to address someone familiarly, as in using "tu" in place of this more formal French pronoun

(0, 0).clue: In 1497 the 4 ships under his command included the Berrio & the Sao Rafael
